Colophon

Made with ❤ ❤ ❤

So I guess you want to know more about what makes this site tick, huh?

It’s undergoing an open redesign and is a work in progress, so if it looks strange, that’s why.

It’s built on top of Jekyll, a static site generator powered by the Liquid templating engine. This site is hosted on Github Pages.

Design and Concept

I designed the initial concept for the site and its sitemap in Sketch 3.

CSS

No frameworks were used in the creation of this site. I did use SASS and Normalize.css to help me with my CSS workflow and to create the responsive grid used in each of the pages. I also derived my own boilerplate from HTML5 Boilerplate, which I now use with most of my projects. I used Animate.css along with some of my own custom animations to breathe life into some of the elements.

Tools

I update and keep track of this project’s progress with Trello. For my local environment, I used Codekit to automatically compile the Sass files, with Livereload setup to work with the XCode iOS Simulator . My choice of IDE? Why, Atom, of course — configured with Terminal Plus, Emmet and Power Mode.

Images

To make the images adaptive, I wrote a custom script that points the page to the appropriate image based on the size of the screen. I own most of the images used on this site, except for the Space Invaders animation used in my 404 page.

Typography and Icons

Typography-wise, I used Work Sans by Google Fonts for my body copy and Calendas Plus by Atipo for stylized text. For icon fonts, I have Font Awesome for UI icons and Technology Icons.

My Markdown documents are parsed with kramdown.

Twenty seven. That’s the number of coffees consumed so far in the course of this project.

The full source of this site is available on Github.
